author: Kathryn O’Shea-Evans
title: Copy the Paint Colors of the Rich and Famous
text:
YOU MAY never amass the capital to build a pile like George Vanderbilt’s 35-bedroom Biltmore Estate, in North Carolina, but you can match the sumptuous color of this wealthy aesthete’s bedroom walls. Generally inexpensive, house paint is the Chanel lipstick of interiors, a point at which the hoi polloi and upper crust intersect. Certain paint colors, however, weren’t accessible to most people until fairly recently. 

In 18th-century England, for example, the affluent tended to choose hues such as an academic deep green, which...
